definition: the work of cleansing (usually with soap and water), to cleanse (itself or another animal) by licking
details:
noun
- the work of cleansing (usually with soap and water)
= synonyms: washing, lavation
- any enterprise in which losses and gains cancel out
= example: any enterprise in which losses and gains cancel out
- garments or white goods that can be cleaned by laundering
= synonyms: washing, laundry, washables
- a watercolor made by applying a series of monochrome washes one over the other
= synonyms: wash drawing
- a thin coat of water-base paint
- the dry bed of an intermittent stream (as at the bottom of a canyon)
= synonyms: dry wash
- the flow of air that is driven backwards by an aircraft propeller
= synonyms: race, backwash, slipstream, airstream
- the erosive process of washing away soil or gravel by water, as from a roadway
= example: the erosive process of washing away soil or gravel by water, as from a roadway
= synonyms: washout
verb
- to cleanse (itself or another animal) by licking
= example: to cleanse (itself or another animal) by licking
- cleanse (one's body) with soap and water
= synonyms: lave
- wash or flow against
= synonyms: lap
- make moist
= synonyms: moisten, dampen
- form by erosion
= example: form by erosion
- remove by the application of water, other liquid, soap or other cleaning agent
= example: remove by the application of water, other liquid, soap or other cleaning agent
= synonyms: wash out, wash off, wash away
- apply a thin coating of paint, metal, etc., to
- clean with some chemical process
= synonyms: rinse
- cleanse with a cleaning agent, such as soap, and water
= synonyms: launder
- separate dirt or gravel from (precious minerals)
- move by or as if by water
= example: move by or as if by water
- admit to testing or proof
= example: admit to testing or proof
- be capable of being washed
= example: be capable of being washed
